messages.title: We can't go on like this.
messages.content: Vote for change and action now on debt to get the economy moving, get Britain working by boosting enterprise, make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe, back the NHS, raise standards in schools, and change politics.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support aspiration and opportunity by cutting taxes, reducing government debt and waste, and lowering interest rates.
Mend society by encouraging responsibility and support for those who do right.
Give more control to the people, sort out MPs' expenses and cut the cost of politics.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Get Britain working by boosting enterprise
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut corporation tax rates and help new businesses create jobs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improve state pension, recognize marriage in the tax system and back couples in the benefits system.
Increase spending on health every year and make the NHS work for patients not managers.
Improve discipline, create new smaller schools and empower teachers.
Reduce the number of MPs, cut quangos and ensure transparency in government spending.

issues.economy: Vote for change and action now on debt to get the economy moving.
issues.education: Raise standards in schools, improve discipline, create new smaller schools.
issues.governance: Change politics by giving more control to the people, sorting out MPs' expenses, cutting the cost of politics, reducing the number of MPs, and ensuring transparency.
issues.health: Back the NHS by increasing spending on health every year and making it work for patients not managers.
issues.socialWelfare: Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe by improving the state pension system, recognizing marriage in the tax system, and supporting young families.

quotes.text: 5 more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or change with the Conservatives.

images.caption: David Cameron writing at a desk.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet juxtaposes the continuity of a 'tired government' under Gordon Brown with the promise of change under the Conservatives led by David Cameron.
